title: augGauss
text: can save simulated data setting save_data argument TRUE
code: sim_data <- simulate_data(nSubj = 10, nGroups = 3)  sim_data  |> print(n = 6) #> # A tibble: 630 × 4 #>    subj group      x     y #>   <dbl> <chr>  <dbl> <dbl> #> 1     1 group1 -0.5  0     #> 2     1 group1 -0.45 0     #> 3     1 group1 -0.4  0     #> 4     1 group1 -0.35 0     #> 5     1 group1 -0.3  0.666 #> 6     1 group1 -0.25 0.307 #> # ℹ 624 more rows sim_data <- simulate_data(nSubj = 10, nGroups = 3, save_data = TRUE)

title: augGauss
code: plot_simulated_data(sim_data) transformed_data <- sim_data |> transform_data()  combined <- aug_fit_model(transformed_data = transformed_data, iter = 100, chains = 2) #> Warning: There were 41 divergent transitions after warmup. title: Simulate augmented Gaussian gradients — simulate_data
code: simulate_data(   nSubj,   nGroups,   dimVals = seq(-0.5, +0.5, 0.05),   M = c(0, 0, 0.1),   H = c(80, 75, 70),   WM = c(0.2, 0.2, 0.2),   WP = c(0.4, 0.4, 0.4),   Noise = 2,   save_data = FALSE,   path = "output/" )

title: Simulate augmented Gaussian gradients — simulate_data
text: nSubj number subjects nGroups number experimental groups dimVals dimension values M ... H ... WM ... WP ... Noise ... save_data logical, save data .csv path path save .csv output

title: Simulate augmented Gaussian gradients — simulate_data
text: tibble simulated data

title: Simulate augmented Gaussian gradients — simulate_data
text: Jessica Lee

title: Simulate augmented Gaussian gradients — simulate_data
code: simulate_data #> function (nSubj, nGroups, dimVals = seq(-0.5, +0.5, 0.05), M = c(0,  #>     0, 0.1), H = c(80, 75, 70), WM = c(0.2, 0.2, 0.2), WP = c(0.4,  #>     0.4, 0.4), Noise = 2, save_data = FALSE, path = "output/")  #> { #>     df <- list() #>     for (g in 1:nGroups) { #>         m <- stats::rnorm(nSubj, M[g], 0.1) #>         h = stats::rnorm(nSubj, H[g], 1) #>         wm = abs(stats::rnorm(nSubj, WM[g], 0.1)) #>         wp = abs(stats::rnorm(nSubj, WP[g], 0.1)) #>         noise = rep(Noise, nSubj) #>         simData <- matrix(nrow = nSubj, ncol = length(dimVals)) #>         for (i in 1:nSubj) { #>             gausLeft <- h[i] * exp(1)^-(((dimVals - m[i])^2)/(2 *  #>                 wm[i]^2)) + stats::rnorm(length(dimVals), 0,  #>                 noise) #>             gausRight <- h[i] * exp(1)^-(((dimVals - m[i])^2)/(2 *  #>                 wp[i]^2)) + stats::rnorm(length(dimVals), 0,  #>                 noise) #>             mIdx <- which.min(abs(dimVals - m[i])) #>             if (mIdx == 1) { #>                 simData[i, ] <- c(gausLeft[1], gausRight[(mIdx +  #>                   1):length(dimVals)]) #>             } #>             else { #>                 simData[i, ] <- c(gausLeft[1:(mIdx - 1)], gausRight[mIdx:length(dimVals)]) #>             } #>         } #>         subj <- rep(1:nSubj + (g - 1) * nSubj, each = length(dimVals)) #>         x <- rep(dimVals, times = nSubj) #>         y <- as.vector(t(simData)) #>         y[y > 100] <- 100 #>         y[y < 0] <- 0 #>         group <- rep(paste0("group", g), nSubj) #>         df[[g]] <- data.frame(cbind(subj, group, x, y)) #>     } #>     out <- do.call("rbind", df) #>     out <- dplyr::tibble(dplyr::mutate(out, x = as.numeric(as.character(x)),  #>         y = as.numeric(as.character(y)), subj = as.numeric(as.character(subj)))) #>     if (!file.exists(path))  #>         dir.create(path) #>     if (save_data == TRUE)  #>         readr::write_csv(out, paste0(path, Sys.Date(), "_simulated_data",  #>             ".csv")) #>     else return(out) #> } #> <bytecode: 0x556261e756b8> #> <environment: namespace:augGauss>
